label: 菩薩
本: Sand and Pebbles: The Tales of Mujû Ichien, A Voice for Pluralism in Kamakura Buddhism . State University of New York Press . 1985
説明文: One who has earned the reward of Buddhahood but who selflessly postpones it in order to work for the salvation of others; the Mahāyānist (daijō, q. v.) ideal embodying wisdom and compassion. See honji-suijaku; also Conze 1951, 125-130.　[大乗、本地垂迹]
